thread.title: Newswire: Here’s some footage from Black Sabbath’s final concert
thread.title_full: Newswire: Here’s some footage from Black Sabbath’s final concert

author: Sam Barsanti
title: Newswire: Here’s some footage from Black Sabbath’s final concert
text:
(Photo: Getty Images For ABA, Frazer Harrison) (Photo: Getty Images For ABA, Frazer Harrison) Share Tweet 
After a little bit of hemming and hawing , Black Sabbath finally held what was ostensibly its final concert ever last night in the band’s hometown of Birmingham, England. Over the course of a 16-song set list, Black Sabbath played pretty much every song a fan would’ve wanted to hear at a final concert, including “War Pigs,” “Iron Man,” “N.I.B.,” and of course “Paranoid,” which the band played as an encore while dumping confetti on the crowd. According to Rolling Stone , Ozzy Osbourne asked the audience at one point if they were having fun and if Sabbath should come back and put another big show at some point, and after waiting a moment, he crushed anyone’s hopes that the band would delay the end another time by simply saying, “we’re not.” Also, despite rumors that original drummer Bill Ward would make an appearance, Rolling Stone says there were no “special guests.” 
Rolling Stone has the full set list, and you can see some videos from the concert below.
